Lead Organization(s): Council for Geoscience (CGS), Wits University), South Africa,Pennsylvania State University (Penn State), USA
Abstract: Africa Array advancing Geophysics in Africa

The Southern and Eastern Africa Mineral Centre (SEAMIC), headquartered in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, was established to provide geoscientific services to its member states. SEAMIC focuses on geological mapping, mineral exploration, laboratory analysis, and capacity building to support sustainable mineral resource development in the region.

Initiative/Item Name: Africa Major Mineral Deposits Web Map
Lead Organization(s): Regional Centre for Mapping of Resource for Development (RCMRD)
Abstract: This dataset shows Regional locations and general geologic setting of known deposits of major nonfuel mineral commodities in Africa

The African Climate and Development Initiative (ACDI) is a leading institute based at the University of Cape Town, dedicated to addressing the complex challenges of climate change and sustainable development from an African perspective.

Initiative/Item Name: African Geological and Mineral Information System (GMIS)
Abstract:
The Geological and Mineral Information System (GMIS) Strategy has been produced by the African Mineral Development Centre (AMDC) to facilitate the strengthening of the African production, management and dissemination of geological and mineral information necessary for several important legal, economic, social and environmental applications. 
The AMDC led development of the GMIS Strategy as part of its mission to implement the African Mining Vision (AMV), which sets out how mining can be used to drive continental development. Development of the Strategy was highly collaborative, and represents the first time that so many stakeholders in geological information at national, regional and continental level have come together to produce a pan-African strategy.

The African Groundwater Network (AGW-Net) is an initiative aimed at enhancing the sustainable management of groundwater resources in Africa. It promotes capacity building, knowledge sharing, and policy advocacy for groundwater management to address water scarcity and support socio-economic development.

The ARF program aims to empower African researchers with PhDs or extensive experience in Earth Observation (EO) to engage in research and development activities relevant to African challenges, particularly in water resource management and food security.

The African Seismological Commission (AfSC) is a regional commission under the International Seismological Centre, focused on earthquake monitoring, research, and capacity building across Africa. It seeks to improve disaster preparedness and resilience by developing seismological knowledge and technologies suitable for the African context
The Belinga project focuses on developing iron ore resources in Gabon, aiming to establish a significant large-scale mining operation.

Initiative/Item Name: CORDIS EU research results: African-European Georesources Observation System (AEGOS)
Abstract: AEGOS is planned as an effective management system providing data and information on the geopotential of natural mineral resources, as well as the georesources geothermal energy and groundwater. These data and information is to be made available via the internet, not only for political and economic decision makers but also for the general public.
Deep-South Resources is undertaking exploration work at three large-scale copper exploration licenses in the Zambian Copperbelt, aiming to identify significant copper deposits.

Data from geophysical surveys in many African countries carried out by the British Geological Survey for different agencies. The surveys range from regional gravity and airborne magnetic mapping to targeted surveys for mineral and water. Individual surveys do not yet have metadata entries: this entry describes a notional database that represents all geophysical surveys carried out within the region.

Geoscience Africa is an initiative by Cardiff University, aimed at fostering collaboration between geoscientists in Africa and the UK. The program focuses on capacity building, research, and education to address pressing challenges in geology, mining, energy resources, and environmental sustainability. Through partnerships with African universities and organizations, the initiative seeks to advance research on Africa's unique geology and support sustainable development

Lead Organization(s): BGR (Bundesanstalt für Geowissenschaften und Rohstoffe)and IUGS CGI (Commission for the Management and Application of Geoscience Information)
Abstract: The GIRAFnetwork was founded as a platform and network for African geoscience information experts to share information and experience and to cooperate across political boundaries. It was also created as a forum to discuss and understand the real needs and issues in geoscience information management, delivery and technology in Africa and to facilitate the inclusion of African geoscience information experts into international initiatives and projects. The ultimate aim of the GIRAF network is to improve the environmental conditions and economic circumstances in Africa by application of information technology based on geoscience data and information. GIRAF was founded in 2009, the inaugural conference-workshop being held in Windhoek (Namibia), and the network has grown ever since.

Initiative/Item Name: Horn of Africa - Groundwater for Resilience Project
Abstract: The Horn of Africa Groundwater for Resilience Project aims to enhance sustainable groundwater management to improve water security and climate resilience in the Horn of Africa. This initiative focuses on groundwater mapping, resource development, and capacity building to support drought-prone and water-scarce regions. It also seeks to reduce water-related vulnerabilities, ensure reliable access to groundwater resources, and strengthen regional cooperation.
Website/Link: Development Projects : Horn of Africa - Groundwater for Resilience Project - P174867

Lead Organization(s): Enertrag SE and Nicholas Holdings Limited
Abstract: project focused  on green hydrogen production leveraging the country's vast renewable energy potential

The International Geoscience Programme (IGCP) is a cooperative venture of UNESCO and the International Union of Geological Sciences (IUGS). It fosters scientific collaboration and research on key geoscientific issues such as natural resources, climate change, geological hazards, and water resources.
The Kamoa-Kakula project involves the development of one of the world's largest copper resources, focusing on sustainable and efficient mining practices.
Focuses on sustainable way of sourcing the platinum group metals
exploration and evaluation of shale gas resources in South Africa's Karoo region
Website/Link: detailed geophysical surveys and published findings

Abstract: KoBold Metals utilizes artificial intelligence to identify and explore untapped mineral deposits, focusing on critical minerals essential for the energy transition.
targeting heavy earth elements that are critical for renewable energy systems
focus on ion adsorption clay deposits that are source of rare earth elements

The Menengai Geothermal Development Project is a major geothermal energy initiative in Kenya, focusing on harnessing geothermal power from the Menengai caldera, located in the Rift Valley region. Spearheaded by the Geothermal Development Company (GDC), the project aims to generate 460 MW of geothermal energy through exploration, well drilling, and power plant construction, contributing to Kenya's sustainable energy goals and reducing reliance on fossil fuels.
The Mokambo Copper Mine project focuses on developing copper resources in Mufulira, aiming to create significant employment opportunities.
These projects involve exploration for copper resources in Zambia's North-Western Province, leveraging cooperation agreements to enhance exploration activities.

Initiative/Item Name: Pan-African Support to the EuroGeoSurveys – Organisation of African Geological Surveys (EGS-OAGS) Partnership (PanAfGeo)
Abstract: PanAfGeo is a project that supports the training of geoscientific staff from African Geological Surveys through the development of an innovative training programme that includes the acquisition and development of important professional skills to complement their technical capabilities and qualifications.

Initiative/Item Name: Pan-African Support to the EuroGeoSurveys – Organisation of African Geological Surveys (EGS-OAGS) Partnership (PanAfGeo) - 2
Abstract:
PanAfGeo-2 is a continuation of the well-established PanAfGeo Project. The PanAfGeo-2 actions are based on and implemented through trainings done in different geoscientific domains. These trainings will be delivered in face-to-face form, field trips and on-the-job sessions, depending on the respective thematic areas.
PanAfGeo-2 also aims to support capacity building at a political, institutional and technical level in Africa by focusing on georesources governance. By involving management level, senior African geoscientists and leaders we will improve the overall system at national, continental and international level, in particular by boosting Africa-EU synergies. All activities of PanAfGeo-2 shall reinforce the governance and sustainable management of georesources within the African-EU Partnership.

The Pan African University (PAU) is a Continental initiative of the African Union Commission (AUC), Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. It is the culmination of the decision of the Assembly of Heads of State and Governments of the African Union to create the Pan African University (EX.CL/579 (XVII) in 2009.The aim of Pan African University is to develop institutions of excellence in science, technology, innovation, social sciences and governance, which would constitute the bedrock for an Africa pool of higher education and research.
targets the recovery of rare earth elements
The SilverKing project involves acquiring a majority stake in a copper mine in Mumbwa District, aiming to revitalize and expand copper production.

SAMGeP is a research initiative focused on marine geoscience in South Africa. The program aims to enhance the understanding of the geology of South Africa's marine environment, including its continental shelf and offshore mineral resources. It emphasizes environmental sustainability, supports marine spatial planning, and contributes to the blue economy by identifying economic opportunities in offshore resources.
The Tendao project involves gold exploration in the Kilo-Moto greenstone belt, considered one of the world's most prospective gold regions.

The West African Exploration Initiative (WAXI) is a collaborative research and capacity-building program aimed at enhancing mineral exploration in West Africa. Established in 2006, WAXI has evolved through several phases, with a focus on integrating scientific research with the development of local geological survey capabilities and educational institutions.
